taxon_name.authority: (A. Gray) Rydberg in N. L. Britton et al.

place_of_publication.place_in_publication: 2: 84, plate 12, fig. F, plate 13, fig. D. 1949

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe heliantheae;subtribe baeriinae;genus pseudobahia;species peirsonii

bio:treatment.description: Plants to 70 cm. Leaves 20–60 mm, mostly 2-pinnately (1-pinnately in smaller plants) lobed (lobes 1–5 mm wide). Peduncles 20–80 mm. Phyllaries ± 8, connate at bases, oblanceolate. Ray florets ± 8. Disc florets 25+; tubes cylindro-funnelform, gradually dilated, lobes with glandular hairs. Cypselae ± 3 mm. 2n = 16.
bio:treatment.discussion: Within populations, some individuals of Pseudobahia peirsonii have ray corollas with ultraviolet-reflective tips, others not.
